content.question: An increase in the price of good X causes buyers to want to buy more of good Y. Which of the following explains the resulting change in the market?

choices.label: The demand curve for good X will shift to the right because the goods are substitutes in consumption.
The demand curve for good Y will shift to the right because the goods are substitutes in consumption.
The demand curve for good X will shift to the left because the goods are complements in consumption.
The demand curve for good Y will shift to the left because the goods are complements in consumption.
There will be a downward movement along the demand curve for good X because the goods are complements in consumption.

content.answer: The demand curve for good Y will shift to the right because the goods are substitutes in consumption.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine the effect(s) of one or more changes on other economic markets.
